title: 2004–05 in Belgian football
text:
The 2004–05 season was the 102nd competitive season in <a href="Belgium">Belgian</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a>.
Overview.
The Brussels derby is played once again since <a href="F.C.%20Molenbeek%20Brussels%20Strombeek">FC Brussels</a> promoted.
National team.
Belgium began their qualifying campaign for the <a href="Football%20World%20Cup%202006">Football World Cup 2006</a>.
Key
Final tables.
Third division.
Third division A.
For their second season since the renewal of the club, <a href="Y.R.%20K.V.%20Mechelen">Y.R. K.V. Mechelen</a> gained the title this time "in extremis" before R. Cappellen F.C., who reaches the third division playoffs along with Torhout 1992 K.M. and <a href="F.C.%20Denderleeuw">F.C. Denderleeuw</a> respectively winners of the first and second slices. The third slice went to Mechelen so it is Cappellen that replaces them in the playoffs. K.F.C. Evergem-Center and K. Lyra T.S.V. are relegated to <a href="Belgian%20Promotion">promotion</a> while K.S.K. Wevelgem City will fight in the Promotion playoffs.
Third division B.
United Overpelt-Lommel won this year's edition with a comfortable advance and also won the last two slices. Oud-Heverlee Leuven has won the first slice so the 3rd and 4th placed teams (respectively <a href="K.S.K.%20Tongeren">K.S.K. Tongeren</a> and R. Sprimont Comblain Sport) enter the <a href="Belgian%20Third%20Division%20Playoff">playoffs</a>. At the bottom of the table, Seraing R.U.L. and Veldwezelt will play <a href="Belgian%20Promotion">Promotion</a> next season while <a href="U.R.%20Namur">U.R. Namur</a> will have to undergo the playoffs.
